FuncDef:
The nat64 instance command creates a NAT64 instance or enters the specified NAT64 instance view.
The undo nat64 instance command deletes a NAT64 instance.
By default, no NAT64 instance is configured.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a NAT64 instance.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 characters.

Specifies the ID of a NAT64 instance.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4095.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
A NAT64 instance is a platform for NAT64 attribute configuration. The NAT64 attributes that can be configured include a NAT64 address pool, NAT64 ALG, and a limit on the maximum number of NAT64 sessions. For user traffic assigned to a NAT64 instance, NAT64 operations are performed based on NAT64 attributes configured for the NAT64 instance.
Configuration Impact
After the nat64 instance command is run and the specified NAT64 instance does not exist, an instance with the specified name is created and the NAT64 instance view is displayed. If the name exists, the view of the specified NAT64 instance is displayed.
Follow-up Procedure
Run the display nat64 instance command to view the configuration of the NAT64 instance.
Precautions
The IDs of master and backup NAT64 instances must be the same in an inter-chassis backup scenario.
